intro: Trollius miyabei, commonly known as the Japanese buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It features showy, yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically divided into lobes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Trollius miyabei is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow.
